formalpara.title: Figure 1. Spermatogenesis and MSP
formalpara.para: Shown are various stages in sperm cell development. In primary spermatocytes, MSP (red) begins to assemble as paracrystalline arrays in fibrous bodies associated with the membranous organelles (purple). Assembly continues through the secondary spermatocyte stage. The fibrous body-membranous organelle complexes segregate into the spermatids and, following separation from the residual body (RB), MSP dissociates into the cytosol. Upon activation, MSP reassembles into filamentous fibers in the pseudopod.
